The sound of crashing waves and my childrens giggles created the soundtrack for the devastating images.

title: Two Years After Trump-Kim Meeting, Little to Show for Personal Diplomacy
description: The timing was hardly coincidental when North Koreas foreign minister declared on Friday that hopes for finding peace with South Korea and its protector, the United States, faded away into a dark nightmare, and that talking with President Trump had given way to focusing on a more reliable force to cope with the long-term military threats from the U.S.

title: Jersey Shore Rebellion Erupts Over States Slow Reopening
description: Asbury Park, N.J., is Murphy country.

title: A New York Comedy Club Tries to Bring Back Stand-Up
description: For months, New Yorks stand-up comedians have been deprived of what they love the most: taking the stage of a dingy comedy club, grabbing the microphone off the stand and staring out at a sea of people whose laughter has the power to determine their own self-worth.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: During the initial phase of the coronavirus pandemic, an apparent anomaly was puzzling health experts around the world: Why was the virus pummeling rich countries, but seemed to leave many poorer nations relatively untouched?

title: Cynthia Navaretta, Who Promoted Female Artists, Is Dead at 97
description: Cynthia Navaretta, who with a newsletter, a publishing house and an unflagging enthusiasm promoted female artists for decades, beginning at a time when male domination of the art world was particularly pronounced, died on May 18 at her home in Manhattan. She was 97.

title: After Two Rounds, Jordan Spieth Shows No Signs of Rust
description: FORT WORTH  Maybe the PGA Tours three-month layoff was a blessing in disguise for Jordan Spieth.

title: Pentagon Denies Spying on Americans Protesting Police Killings
description: WASHINGTON  A top Pentagon official has told Congress that the nations military intelligence agencies did not spy on American protesters during the wave of nationwide demonstrations against the police killings of African-Americans.

title: Calls for Transforming Police Run Into Realities of Governing in Minnesota
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The calls for sweeping reforms to policing that have reverberated since the death of George Floyd slammed into the messy realities of lawmaking on Friday, offering a glimpse of the uncertainties of turning protest into policy.

title: Graduating West Point Cadets Isolate for Two Weeks Ahead of Trump Speech
description: WASHINGTON  The graduating cadets at the United States Military Academy at West Point have lived in Covid-19 quarantine for the past two weeks, confined to their dorms, wearing masks and watching Zoom conferences on leadership as they wait for President Trump to speak at their commencement on Saturday.

title: Dave Chappelles Netflix Special: Three Key References to Know
description: Dave Chappelle released a lacerating new special, 8:46  the length of time that a police officer held his knee on George Floyds neck as Floyd pleaded for his life  that has become among the first live shows in the Covid era to reckon with the protests gripping the nation.

title: Trump Says He Opposes Police Chokeholds, Except in Certain Situations
description: President Trump appeared to support outlawing chokeholds as a law enforcement practice in an interview with Fox News that aired on Friday, but not before he defended their use in certain situations in a rambling response to a question about police reform efforts.

title: Special Episode: The Song That Found Me
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: Prime Minister Boris Johnson Stirs Culture War Over Churchill Statue
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain on Friday stirred a fraught debate over symbols of his countrys past, accusing protesters of seeking to censor our past and telling them it was absurd and shameful that a statue of Winston Churchill needed to be covered to protect it from being vandalized.

title: Club Owners?
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Theres an expression that goes when you hear hoofbeats, think horses, not zebras. If youre doing a Trenton Charlson puzzle, think Quaggas; think lots of high scoring scrabble words, Xs, Qs and Zs in unexpected places. Mr. Charlson is more than a one-trick pony and today there are some good puns and factoids to explore.

title: Celebrate Pride With Town Halls and Club Beats
description: If youre feeling conflicted about how to celebrate Pride this year, youre hardly alone. Three months after the coronavirus pandemic turned the world on its head, America has been rocked by coast-to-coast protests inspired by George Floyd, whose death has led millions to cry out for an end to police brutality  and an end to police departments generally.

title: Roger Cohen: The Outcry Over Both Sides Journalism
description: The acting editorial page editor, Kathleen Kingsbury, wrote about the decision to publish our writers responses to the Tom Cotton Op-Ed in Fridays edition of our Opinion Today newsletter.

title: Latest Crop of West Point Graduates Includes First Observant Sikh Cadet
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump took the stage on Saturday to deliver the commencement speech at West Point, one of the new Army officers he addressed was an Indian-American woman breaking a barrier as old as the 218-year-old military academy.

title: Corrections: June 13, 2020
description: An article on Friday about the renewed scrutiny of European police that has followed the demonstrations against police brutality in the United States misstated the given name of the Human Rights Watch director in France. She is Bndicte Jeannerod, not Batrice.

title: Quotation of the Day: Houses of Prayer, Hope and Testing for Most Affected
description: I know Im not superwoman. Im not going to do reckless things and risk reinfecting myself or reinfecting my parents.

title: Trump Moves Tulsa Rally Date Out of Respect for Juneteenth
description: [Follow our Election Day live tracker.]

title: So You Want to Learn About Juneteenth?
description: Juneteenth, an annual holiday commemorating the end of slavery in the United States, has been celebrated by African-Americans since the late 1800s.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: The Split and a Dateline Special
description: THE SPLIT Stream on Sundance Now, Sundance TV, Amazon, Google Play, Hulu, iTunes and YouTube TV. On the first season of this drama, centered around a family of high-powered divorce lawyers, Ruth Defoe (Deborah Findlay), the matriarch, gives a speech at her daughters wedding that gets at the heart of the series. I have found through life that love and hate are so often intertwined, she says. Or perhaps, I should say, that the love thats there at the start is still there at the end. As Ruth and her daughters Nina (Annabel Scholey) and Hannah (Nicola Walker), both lawyers, help their clients navigate the often heartless legal world of infidelity, prenuptial agreements and divorce, they are forced to come to terms with the emotional challenges in their own relationships. As Margaret Lyons, a television critic for The New York Times, wrote in her Watching column: If you like ensemble dramas in which smart, elegant people stand in nice kitchens and sadly ponder their lives, watch this.

title: The Teachings of the Philosopher of the Black Forest
description: Christian Streich has to go. He is conscious that it is nearing 10 a.m., and training is about to start. His S.C. Freiburg players  he calls them his colleagues  will soon be out on the field, wondering where their coach has gone. With a hint of apology, he wonders if we might, perhaps, make these the last couple of questions?

title: Bubba Wallace Thankful for Flag Ban, but NASCARs Fans Might Not Be
description: Now that Darrell Wallace Jr., the sole African-American driver in NASCARs top racing series, has persuaded the organization to bar the Confederate flag from its events, he expects his life to be a little different.

title: How Black Lives Matter Reached Every Corner of America
description: George Floyds death has sparked more than two weeks of protests in all 50 states. See how the movement spread.

title: 8 Are Shot in San Antonio by Man Claiming to Be U.F.C. Fighter
description: Eight people were shot late Friday in a San Antonio parking lot by a man who, after being turned away from a bar, came back and opened fire with a rifle, the police said.

title: Making Stories of Struggle a Thing of the Past
description: We come from different worlds, my wife and I, but we both call America home.

title: Trump Has Made Alternative Facts a Way of Life
description: No president in the history of our Republic has been as disorienting as Donald Trump. His goal, even before he became president, was far more ambitious than to tell mere lies. It was to annihilate the distinction between truth and falsity, to make sure that we no longer share facts in common, to overwhelm people with misinformation and disinformation. It was to induce epistemological vertigo on a mass scale.

title: When a Cemetery Wedding Was Used to End the Spanish Flu
description: Even as New York reopens ever so cautiously, couples hoping to stage big, boisterous weddings in the city still have a good wait ahead of them before they receive a go-ahead.

title: Finally, a Wedding. It Was About Time.
description: When I was 6, I had an imaginary husband I named Dave the Watchmaker. We had a wedding ceremony in the living room where my grandma sat as the lone guest while my mother played the organ. I carried a giant baby doll with me down the aisle to meet Dave.

title: How a New Yorker Cartoonist Spends Her Sundays
description: Liana Fincks cartoons have wobbly lines, potato-headed characters with names like blunt person, and a deeply sympathetic contemporary anguish. The most relatable thing, Ms. Finck said, is to show the thought in its original, messy form.

title: Vet Your Social Media
description: With the combination of camera phones and social media, more people than ever are being made aware of incidents of police brutality and racial inequality, and of the protests they have touched off.But making sense of the deluge of posts in the present moment can be difficult.

title: How to Get Your Kids to Stay 6 Feet Away From Everything
description: Its hard enough for adults to maintain social distancing  youve seen those photos of crowded beaches and parks  but for young children? Thats a whole other challenge. Here are some tips for getting your kids (especially those under 5) to care about wearing masks and steering six feet away from strangers.

title: Faced With Crisis and Re-election, Senate Republicans Blame China
description: WASHINGTON  When Senator Martha McSally, one of the most politically endangered Republicans, was asked last month about reports that President Trump had brushed away warnings from his own aides about the looming threat of the coronavirus, she promptly pivoted.

title: Bidens Vice-Presidential Search: Whos on the List and Where It Stands
description: [Joe Biden selected Senator Kamala Harris of California as his vice-presidential running mate.]

title: Young New Yorkers Want You to Know Why Theyre Marching
description: They are movement newbies.

title: The Economy Is Reeling. The Tech Giants Spy Opportunity.
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Even as Facebook grappled this month with an internal revolt and a cascade of criticism over its refusal to take action on President Trumps inflammatory posts, the social network was actively making other bets behind the scenes.

title: In Every Corner of Bangkok, Spirits Need a Home and Maybe a Strawberry Fanta
description: BANGKOK  These spirits were not wearing face masks. They appeared well fed, untroubled by the hunger pangs that have afflicted some Thais during the lean times of a pandemic.

title: Its Something I Wanted to Carry With Me: Marking a Movement in Ink
description: MINNEAPOLIS  After George Floyd died in police custody in Minneapolis last month, Dashinque Hall watched her city become the center of a protest movement.

title: Too Close for Comfort, and the Virus, in Russias Communal Apartments
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  Through the thin wall separating her from her neighbors, Dr. Anzhela Kirilova began to hear the rasping cough associated with Covid-19 sometime in May. That was hardly a surprise, as a few weeks earlier her neighbors had heard the same cough coming from her room.

title: Beijing Shuts Down Seafood Market After Dozens Test Positive for Coronavirus
description: The Beijing authorities shut down a major seafood and produce market and locked down several residential complexes on Saturday after 53 people tested positive for the coronavirus in the city, renewing fears that Chinas grip on the pandemic is not yet secure.

title: Stick a Starry Night Sky on Your Ceiling
description: By now, youve spent more than enough time inside, and although you may be trying to get back out into nature, the options are still limited, especially after sunset. If you have a backyard or balcony and a clear moonless night, you might be able to look up and glimpse a few stars. But with the effects of light pollution, if you want to really see the stars  and lots of them  youll need to bring them to you.

title: 5 Podcasts at the Intersection of Pride Month and the Black Lives Matter Movement
description: This year, Pride has been forced back to its roots. Instead of celebrities waving from floats sponsored by TD Bank and Absolut Vodka, pandemic-masked protesters are marching in the streets demanding justice for black lives. Rainbow flags have been replaced with signs with the names of those killed by the police, like Tony McDade, a black trans man in Tallahassee, Fla. These protests may be perhaps the most genuine honoring of Pride, an annual commemoration of the 1969 Stonewall uprising, in which black and brown L.G.B.T.Q. people were a driving force. There is much to learn this Pride, and a legion of queer voices in podcasting can help you gain insight, find representation and feel comfort during this time. Here are a few of our recommendations.

title: China Reports 57 New Coronavirus Cases Amid Beijing Outbreak
description: This briefing has ended. Check here for the latest updates.

title: Talking With Relatives Across the Political Divide
description: Since the killing of George Floyd, which set off protests three weeks ago, many families have had tough conversations about race  some with relatives expressing dissimilar perspectives.

title: What Were Learning About Online Learning
description: Over four days in mid-March, Cindy Hansen, an 11th grade English teacher at Timpanogos High School in Orem, Utah, had to go fully virtual, and took her class of some 30 students reading The Great Gatsby online.

title: Rage and Promises Followed Ferguson, but Little Changed
description: America has been here before: a black man on the asphalt dying at the hands of the police. Convulsive protests across the country. A national reckoning. Vows to change.

title: Is It OK to Have Your Air-Conditioners Installed Yet?
description: Q: I havent hired anyone to install my window unit air-conditioners yet because Ive been concerned about letting workers into my apartment during the pandemic. But now that the city is reopening, does that mean its safe to install them? Will my Manhattan co-op even allow someone to come in and do the work?

title: Tommie Smiths Fist Is Still Raised: We Still Need to Fight
description: In 1968, Tommie Smith and John Carlos stepped to the podium at the Olympics in Mexico City to receive their medals in the 200-meter dash. Wearing black socks and no shoes to represent poverty and black gloves to signify black power and liberation, the sprinters raised their fists.

title: Cory Booker on Newark Pride, Black Lives Matter and This Distraught Present
description: Senator Cory Booker of New Jersey has long made criminal justice core to his politics, a focus that began during his days at Stanford, continued through his two terms as mayor of Newark and eventually formed the backbone of his presidential campaign.

title: Get Creative to Celebrate Dad
description: Celebrating Fathers Day is shaping up to be tricky. The country is reopening, but experts have said to remain cautious and limit indoor gatherings. And, with millions of Americans out of a job, this may not be the best time to splurge on a present. What to do instead? Below, some meaningful ways you can honor Dad this year.

title: Family of Atlanta Shooting Victim Disputes Police Account
description: This briefing has ended. Follow our live coverage of Atlanta, Black Lives Matter and police protests here.

title: Ex-Officer Accused of Murdering Floyd Could Get $50,000 Annual Pension
description: Even if the former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin is found guilty of murdering George Floyd, he will qualify to receive what could amount to around $50,000 a year in state pension payments.

title: Tanker Truck Blast on China Highway Kills 19
description: Nineteen people died and more than 170 were injured in the eastern Chinese province of Zhejiang on Saturday after a truck carrying liquefied gas exploded on a highway.

title: Guaranteed Ingredient in Any Coronavirus Vaccine? Thousands of Volunteers
description: Not long after researchers completed their work with mice, guinea pigs, ferrets and monkeys, Human Subject 8, an art director for a software company in Missouri, received an injection. Four days later, her sister, a schoolteacher, became Subject 14.

title: Strawberry Pie Forever
description: The weeks most popular dishes include Samantha Seneviratnes fresh strawberry pie (above), Genevieve Kos toasted coconut rice with bok choy and fried eggs, and Kay Chuns roasted salmon with miso rice and ginger-scallion vinaigrette. Find more recipes in the collection below.

title: Savor a Week Full of History and Hope
description: Here is a sampling of the weeks events  and how to tune in (all times are Eastern).

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: SPLIT DECISIONS  All of the encouragement that I offer to solvers comes from the heart and from my own experience, but I have to admit that the more I solve Split Decisions puzzles, the worse I get at them. Its the necessity of strategizing; I'm either overconfident and run pell-mell through a series of mistakes, or I become paralyzed by the number of possibilities for a series of entries. By definition, this variety of puzzle is full of pitfalls.

title: Call Off the Dogs, Mr. Trump
description: When President Trump tweeted late last month that the Secret Service was prepared to sic the most vicious dogs on protesters outside the White House, I was dismayed, as both a dog lover and an American citizen. I strongly suspect that the handlers of the highly trained dogs that assist the agents in their duties were deeply shocked, too.

title: What You Can Learn From a Dreamer in Arizona
description: PHOENIX  Angel Palazuelos donned a maroon cap and gown one recent afternoon, one of two colors of his alma mater, Metro Tech High School, where almost every student is an immigrant or comes from a family of immigrants. The school is part of the Phoenix Union High School District, one of the largest in the country and one whose enrollment reflects Arizonas impending demographic destiny as a majority Latino state.

title: Far-Right Groups Push Back as Protesters Rally in Europe
description: LONDON  Thousands of people rallied against police brutality and racism in European cities on Saturday, punctuating a week of protests across the continent, but far-right demonstrators also emerged in large groups for the first time  particularly in London  leading to sometimes violent confrontations that included attacks on police officers.

title: The Risks When Colleges Reopen
description: To the Editor:

title: Trumps Lessons From Nixon Missed One Important Thing
description: [Follow our live Trump vs Biden 2020 election updates and analysis.]

title: Art World Wunderkind Arrested Months After Fleeing the U.S.
description: Inigo Philbrick, the elusive contemporary art dealer who disappeared in the fall after being accused of defrauding clients of more than $20 million, was arrested on Thursday by U.S. law enforcement agents on the Pacific island of Vanuatu. Mr. Philbrick has since been transported to Guam, where he is expected to be presented in federal court on June 15, according to a statement from the U.S. attorneys office of the Southern District of New York.

title: Trump Speaks at West Point Graduation Amid Tensions With Military Leaders
description: President Trump told the Armys newest officers on Saturday that they will not have to serve in endless wars being waged in far away lands, but made no mention of his thwarted effort in recent days to deploy the active-duty military to the streets of American cities over the objections of Pentagon leaders.

title: From Cosmetics to NASCAR, Calls for Racial Justice Are Spreading
description: The reckonings have been swift and dizzying.

title: Far-Right Groups Stage Counterprotest in London
description: The counterprotests on Saturday turned violent at times, with far-right groups clashing with the police and with people demonstrating against police brutality and racism.

title: The End of Black Politics
description: Young black people have exploded in rebellion over the grotesque killing of George Floyd. We are now witnessing the broadest protest movement in American history. And yet the response of black elected officials has been cautious and uninspired.

title: Brazil President Embraces Unproven Cure as Pandemic Surges
description: [Read more on Brazils Coronavirus cases and deaths.]

title: Dont Leave the W.H.O. Strengthen It.
description: The world is fighting the most serious pandemic in a century, and the United States is in the process of withdrawing from the only international organization equipped to lead that effort.

title: Its Trumps Revolution
description: In 1804, the Corsican upstart Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself as Frances emperor. His mother, born Letizia Ramolino, did not attend the coronation. Informed of her sons self-elevation, she is said to have remarked coolly: Lets hope it lasts.

title: An Anti-Trump Slam Dunk
description: WASHINGTON  Shut up and dribble.

title: The Surprising Origin of Our Modern Nation of Immigrants
description: It was early evening when Michael Feighan arrived at the White House on May 7, 1965. A tall, dour Democratic congressman from Ohio, Feighan had an important meeting with President Lyndon B. Johnson.

title: What the Pandemic Reveals About the Male Ego
description: Are female leaders better at fighting a pandemic?

title: A St. Johns Fencing Coach Is Fired After Making Racist Remarks
description: An assistant fencing coach for St. Johns University was fired this week after making derogatory remarks about black people in a private lesson, including that they cause the most trouble.

title: Fox News Removes a Digitally Altered Image of Seattle Protests
description: Fox News removed photos accompanying its coverage of Seattles demonstrations from its website on Friday after acknowledging that one was a combination of several different images and a second photo was of a fiery scene in a different city.

title: Atlanta Police Chief Resigns After Officer Shoots and Kills a Black Man
description: ATLANTA  Less than 24 hours after a white police officer shot and killed an African-American man outside a fast-food restaurant, Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms of Atlanta announced on Saturday that the citys police chief had resigned.

title: U.N. Expresses Horror at Mass Graves in Libya
description: CAIRO  The United Nations chief expressed horror at the discovery of at least eight mass graves in Libya in recent days and called for a prompt and transparent investigation into possible war crimes.

title: Texas Football Players Call on University to Drop a Song Steeped in Racist History
description: For generations, students at the University of Texas at Austin have stood up at sports games, raised their right hand to form the symbol of the storied Texas Longhorns and belted out The Eyes of Texas, a campus anthem.

title: G.O.P. Congressman Faces Primary After Officiating Same-Sex Wedding
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Denver Riggleman, a freshman Republican from Virginia, is facing a primary challenge that will be decided on Saturday in a drive-through state convention following an uproar among local activists after Mr. Riggleman officiated a same-sex wedding.

title: Harry Glickman, Who Brought Basketball to Oregon, Dies at 96
description: Harry Glickman, who founded the Portland Trail Blazers of the National Basketball Association and was widely considered the father of professional sports in Oregon, died on Wednesday in Portland. He was 96.

title: A Reckoning at Cond Nast
description: This was supposed to be Cond Nasts year.

title: Making Arrangements
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  This marks Randolph Rosss 51st Sunday grid for The Times, which obligates him to go to 100, according to the International Cruciverbal Pact that can never be challenged or broken. Fortunately, according to The Times Magazines print introduction, Mr. Ross finds himself productive lately. Staying in my apartment so much these days has increased my crossword solving and constructing, says he. I feel fortunate I have an avocation that keeps my brain engaged.

title: Police Reform Is Necessary. But How Do We Do It?
description: A discussion about changes in policing, moderated by Emily Bazelon.

title: Health Care Advocates Push Back Against Trumps Erasure of Transgender Rights
description: Health advocates representing American hospitals, medical groups, insurers and civil rights associations condemned the Trump administration on Saturday for rolling back protections for transgender patients, and for doing so amid a global pandemic.

title: Trump Made Inaccurate Claims About the Military During His West Point Speech
description: President Trump oversold his administrations military record in a commencement speech at the United States Military Academy at West Point on Saturday. Heres a fact-check of his claims.

title: Atlanta Police Shoot Man Outside a Wendys
description: Surveillance video footage shows the police chasing and shooting Rayshard Brooks, 27, after an altercation that the authorities said began on Friday night after Mr. Brooks fell asleep in his car. Mr. Brooks was taken to a hospital, where he died after surgery.

title: Remains in Idaho Identified as Those of Missing Children
description: Human remains discovered on an Idaho mans property were identified as belonging to his wifes two children who had been missing for months, the police said on Saturday.

title: A Black Man Was Found Hanging From a Tree, and a Community Demands Answers
description: City officials in Palmdale, Calif., said on Saturday that they support calls by activists and residents who have demanded an independent investigation into the death of a 24-year-old black man who was found hanging from a tree in a public square this week.

title: Quotation of the Day: Still Raising a Fist, 52 Years Later
description: All I did was stand there with a fist in the air. It was a cry for freedom.

title: Corrections: June 14, 2020
description: An article on Page 8 about Bob Dylan misspelled a name in a lyric in Key West (Philosophers Pirate). It is Ginsberg, Corso and Kerouac, not Ginsburg, Corso and Kerouac.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: 30 for 30 and Marcella
description: 30 FOR 30: LONG GONE SUMMER 9 p.m. on ESPN. During the summer of 1998, many sports fans seemed to be captivated by one single story  the chase between the St. Louis Cardinals Mark McGwire and the Chicago Cubs Sammy Sosa to beat Roger Mariss record of 61 home runs in a single season. In this documentary, Sosa and McGwire take viewers back to the high-drama slugfest. The film also explores how the revelations of steroid use in the league would later call the accomplishments of the sport and that season into question.

title: One Friday Night, I Pulled Into the Tollbooth at the Henry Hudson Bridge
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Stimulus Backlash Delivers a Global Warning: Value Female Workers
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Shelley Duggan became an essential worker when Australia declared that her job at a suburban child care center must be preserved so that doctors and nurses would have a place to send their children during the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Coronavirus Cases Spike Across Sun Belt as Economy Lurches into Motion
description: CHICAGO  The warning has echoed ominously for weeks from epidemiologists, small-town mayors and county health officials: Once states begin to reopen, a surge in coronavirus cases will follow.

title: How the Stoop and the Sidewalk Helped New Yorkers Stay Sane
description: Impromptu concerts from the fire escape. Food relief efforts staged on the sidewalk in front of a church. Friends spread out on the stoop and drinking tallboys. As the city reopens, New Yorkers emerging from quarantine might feel a bit nostalgic for the socially distant bonds they formed outside their homes. From the first days of the lockdown in April, through the advent of legal drinking in front of restaurants, to protests in the streets for racial justice, The Times collected stories of how neighbors across the five boroughs handled the shutdown and, at times, came together.

title: Coronavirus Ripped A Hole In N.Y.C.s Black Community. This Funeral Director Knows.
description: In New York City, Covid-19 is disproportionately killing black and Latino residents. As the city reopens, a longtime funeral director in Harlem says, Its going to take a long time for people to heal.

title: A New Book Brings Melania Trump Into (Slightly) Better Focus
description: To the Secret Service, he is Mogul and she is Muse. Donald J. Trump and Melania Knauss met in Manhattan in 1998 and married seven years later. He was a real estate guy and she had curb appeal.

title: Coronavirus Created an Obstacle Course for Safe Abortions
description: BRUSSELS  When a 19-year-old woman from southern Poland decided to end her pregnancy at 18 weeks, she knew the only way to get an abortion was to rush to a neighboring European country.

title: Chris Wallace, Insider and Outlier at Fox News
description: Chris Wallace is a registered Democrat who hosts Fox News Sunday, a child of two Jews who keeps a rosary by his bedside, a Washington wonk who has vacationed in Italy with George Clooney.

title: Racial Justice Groups Flooded With Millions in Donations in Wake of Floyd Death
description: The killing of George Floyd and the ensuing nationwide wave of protests are generating a record-setting flood of donations to racial justice groups, bail funds and black-led advocacy organizations across America, remaking the financial landscape of black political activism in a matter of weeks.

title: We Went Inside a Sports Bubble. Heres What We Saw.
description: LAS VEGAS  Robeisy Ramirez had no idea that his fourth professional bout as a featherweight boxer would come in the middle of a pandemic.

title: Black Lives Matter, Reopening, Pride Month: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Michelle Wikum, Walker Williams
description: Michelle Joy Wikum and Walker Samuel Williams were married June 13 at the home of the brides parents in Santa Ana, Calif. The Rev. Dr. Dena L. Williams, a Lutheran minister and the grooms mother, officiated.

title: The Week in Business: The Second Wave Is Coming
description: After another week of widespread protests and relaxed lockdown rules, coronavirus cases are spiking in over a dozen states. What does that mean for the economy? Catch up on the big stories in business and tech for the week ahead, and stay safe.

title: As Social Distancing Wanes, Cuomo Warns of Another Lockdown
description: With sunny and warm weekend weather in New York City and its suburbs, social media feeds were filled with videos and reports of residents violating social distancing rules, including Friday night in Manhattans East Village, a bar-and-restaurant friendly neighborhood. Outdoor drinkers, many without masks, also congregated on street corners in Hells Kitchen on Saturday, where gay pride celebrations were underway.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1 Million
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: Life on the Road in Pandemic America
description: What happens when a dream car is for sale in Florida, you live in Oregon and a pandemic is gripping the country?

title: How Rayshard Brooks Was Fatally Shot by the Atlanta Police
description: [Heres what you need to know about the death of Rayshard Brooks.]

title: The Sunday Read: Getting Out
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: My Favorite String Quartet
description: Half a century ago, a string quartet formed in Vienna. This might not seem like an especially noteworthy event, given that citys towering importance in the history of music  and chamber music, in particular. Surely quartets have always been a dime a dozen there.

title: The Artists Caretaker: Once He Controlled Everything. No More.
description: One person was conspicuously absent from an event at the Farnsworth Museum in Rockland, Maine, last year, a gathering as close to a memorial for Robert Indiana as has been held since his death two years ago.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Joy is in short supply these days, and patience, too. Nerves are tingling. I havent shaken a hand or hugged someone outside my family in more than three months. Cookings supposed to be a solace  I say that every day  but I acknowledge that some days it doesnt seem possible. I do it anyway (gotta eat). I do it anyway (its a practice, same as singing scales, same as draining free throws). I do it anyway (I believe).

title: A Canal That Opened the Montana Prairie May Soon Dry Up
description: CUT BANK, Mont.  A century ago, one of the first of the ambitious federal water projects that helped build the West was constructed to carry water from the mountains of Glacier National Park hundreds of miles east, irrigating an area twice the size of Maryland.

title: As a Black Doctor, Should I Choose My Skin Color or My Health?
description: As a black emergency medicine physician, concern about the spread of Covid-19 at protests in the wake of the murder of George Floyd is not top of my mind. And yet many continue to seize on this concern. The risk of spread of Covid-19 is clearly elevated at demonstrations: People are yelling, stirring up respiratory droplets and projecting them into the air; people are marching long distances, exerting themselves and taking gulps of air in the process; people are standing and kneeling much less than six feet from one another; and mask use is, over all, abundant but admittedly inconsistent.

title: What the Bible Has to Say About Black Anger
description: There are videos of Eric Garner and George Floyd being choked to death by police officers while pleading for their lives. There is a video of Tamir Rice, a 12-year-old boy who was shot to death while playing with a toy gun. There is a video of Ahmaud Arbery, who was hunted and killed while out on a run. There is a video of a police officer mounting and handcuffing Dajerria Becton, 15 years old at the time, at a pool party.

title: Details of Shooting in Atlanta Fuel Debate on Police Use of Force
description: This briefing has ended. Follow our continuing coverage of Atlanta, Black Lives Matter and police protests here.

title: Covid-19 Changed How We Vote. It Could Also Change Who Votes.
description: WASHINGTON  In a normal election year, volunteers from the Columbus, Ohio, chapter of the League of Women Voters would have spent last weekend at the Columbus Arts Fair, pens and clipboards in hand, looking to sign up new voters among the festivals 400,000 or so attendees.

title: Breanna Stewart Pushes for Change on and Off the Court
description: Along with the rest of the world, athletes have had their careers upended by the coronavirus pandemic. They are giving The New York Times an intimate look at their journeys in periodic installments through the rest of the year. Read Stewarts first installment here.

title: Passengers Still Jittery About Flying
description: To the Editor:

title: How Biden Can Fight Racism
description: To the Editor:

title: Trading Sportsbooks for Brokerages, Bored Bettors Wager on Stocks
description: When he wasnt coaching sports, he was playing them or watching them. And if he was watching  well, a little skin in the game always made it more interesting for Steven Young, a teacher outside Philadelphia. Just small-dollar bets, mixed in with shuffling the rosters of his fantasy teams.

title: Desperate for Any Coronavirus Care, Afghans Flock to Herbalists Vaccine
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Every day, thousands of people swarmed Hakeem Alokozais herbal clinic in Kabul seeking their three drops of his Covid-19 vaccine. Some carried IV drips, others oxygen cylinders. Some were brought in ambulances, others in the back of Toyota station wagons. They were laborers, officers of the security forces and even lawmakers in the countrys Parliament.

title: In an English City, an Early Benefactor Is Now a Toxic Brand
description: BRISTOL, England  Standing beneath an empty stone plinth, from which the statue of the 17th-century slave trader Edward Colston was toppled last week, Richard Saunders showed his son photos of three black Americans who had been killed by the police an ocean away and 200 years after the end of Bristols slave trade.

title: G.O.P. Congressman Is Ousted From Right After Officiating at Same-Sex Wedding
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Denver Riggleman, a freshman Republican from Virginia, lost a bitterly contested primary race decided in an unusual drive-through state convention, weighed down by outrage among party activists that he officiated at a same-sex wedding.

title: Slowing the Coronavirus Is Speeding the Spread of Other Diseases
description: As poor countries around the world struggle to beat back the coronavirus, they are unintentionally contributing to fresh explosions of illness and death from other diseases  ones that are readily prevented by vaccines.

title: She Survived the Coronavirus. Then She Got a $400,000 Medical Bill.
description: Janet Mendez started receiving bills soon after returning in April to her mothers home from Mount Sinai Morningside hospital, where she nearly died of Covid-19. First, there was one for $31,165. Unable to work and finding it difficult to walk, Ms. Mendez decided to put the bill out of her mind and focus on her recovery.

title: Fears for Volvo Expose Sour Turn in Swedens Ties With China
description: GOTHENBURG, Sweden   The 2009 meeting in Shanghai between the Swedish union leader and the Chinese Henry Ford started in a minibus ride and ended in one of the financial capitals most opulent hotels. There, the men struck an unlikely alliance to save the struggling Swedish carmaker Volvo.

title: Trumps Halting Walk Down Ramp Raises New Health Questions
description: President Trump faced new questions about his health on Sunday, after videos emerged of him gingerly walking down a ramp at the U.S. Military Academy at West Point and having trouble bringing a glass of water to his mouth during a speech there.

title: After More Proposals, Players Tell M.L.B.: Tell Us When and Where
description: What once seemed like a worst-case scenario for Major League Baseball  a regular season of roughly 50 games  now appears to be all but inevitable.

title: The Long Battle Over Gone With the Wind
description: When HBO Max announced Tuesday that it was temporarily removing Gone With the Wind from its streaming service, it seemed as if another Confederate monument was coming down.

title: Sushant Singh Rajput, Bollywood Star, Dies at 34
description: Sushant Singh Rajput, a prominent actor in Indian films and television programs, was found dead on Sunday in his home in Mumbai. He was 34.

title: Coronavirus Flare-Up, U.S. Police, Facebook: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: My Front-Row View of the Cuomo Briefings
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Events Like Trump Rally Are Perfect Storm for Viral Spread, Experts Say
description: The coronavirus wont be loosening its grip on the United States any time soon, leading infectious disease experts said on Sunday. They are also uncertain how the viral spread will be affected by the patchwork of states reopening businesses and by large events like protests and President Trumps upcoming campaign rallies.

title: How 2 Lives Collided in Central Park, Rattling the Nation
description: Christian Cooper began his Memorial Day like most of his May mornings, searching for Blackburnian warblers, scarlet tanagers and other songbirds that wing their way into Central Park.

title: A Pop-Culture Glossary for Da 5 Bloods
description: Through their blistering engagement with history, pop culture and headlines, Spike Lees movies always brim with references, and Da 5 Bloods, his new feature on Netflix, is no exception. The drama follows four Vietnam veterans, the Bloods  Paul (Delroy Lindo), Otis (Clarke Peters), Eddie (Norm Lewis) and Melvin (Isiah Whitlock Jr.)  who return to the country with a dual purpose: to recover the remains of their fallen comrade and to retrieve the gold they buried. A critique of U.S. exploitation of African-Americans in war and in general, Da 5 Bloods is also an adventure film and a caper movie, filled with callbacks to Lees other works. Below is a guide to some of its many allusions and shout-outs.

title: The Woman Who Took Down a Confederate Flag on What Came Next
description: She knew she would be arrested, but that was the least of her concerns. She had to make it to the top of the flagpole first.

title: Make Better
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Todays grid marks Olivia Mitra Framkes Monday debut and her fifth puzzle with us over all. If youre on a long puzzle streak, youve probably solved her excellent Sunday constructions. (Her first Times puzzle was a Sunday that paid homage to 68A, you might remember.) If youre still working on Mondays, you can try one of her Tuesday puzzles once youre done here.

title: Thousands March for Black Transgender Lives
description: Thousands of demonstrators gathered around the Brooklyn Museum to bring attention to high rates of police violence against black transgender women.

title: Tasers: Are These Police Tools Effective and Are They Dangerous?
description: The fatal police shooting of Rayshard Brooks, a black man who was found asleep in a car in a drive-through at a Wendys on Friday night in Atlanta, has reignited the debate over Tasers.

title: Robert Gates Calls to Replace Base Names From Dark Side of Our History
description: Former Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates joined the call on Sunday to rename Army bases named after Confederate generals despite President Trumps opposition, saying that it was time to rid the American military of symbols that represent the dark side of our history.

title: A Conversation With the Ultrarunner Yassine Diboun
description: Welcome to the Running newsletter! Every Saturday morning, we email runners with news, advice and some motivation to help you get up and running. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.

title: Joe Biden Needs to Learn an Urgent Lesson From the 2004 Election
description: We know that a bad economy tends to hurt the electoral prospects of incumbent presidential candidates. But what about a crisis of national security or American safety? Although the coronavirus pandemic is unprecedented in most ways, as is the Trump presidency itself, there may be historical lessons from other situations.

title: The Pandemic and Protests Have Exposed the Truth About California
description: PASADENA  California, the novelist Wallace Stegner wrote, is like the rest of America, only more so. That truism has played out in recent days in scenes of triumph, anguish and incongruity, a mirror of the country seen through a distinctly California lens.

title: Families Challenge Suicide in Deaths of Black Men Found Hanging From Trees
description: The families of two black men who were found hanged from trees in Southern California are asking the authorities to further investigate their deaths.

title: Author Frances Cha on Achieving the Feminine Ideal
description: Frances Cha, author of If I Had Your Face

title: An Insatiable Rage
description: In the wake of the killing of George Floyd and the massive wave of protests that have swept the country and the world, New York State on Friday passed a package of policing reforms, banning chokeholds and opening police disciplinary records, among other things.

title: Upright Citizens Brigade to Overhaul Its Leadership
description: The Upright Citizens Brigade comedy organization, which has been financially troubled in recent years, has announced an effort to diversify its ranks and remake itself, at least in part, as a nonprofit.

title: More People Will Be Fired in the Pandemic. Lets Talk About It.
description: Years ago, I stumbled across some startling research by economists in England and Australia: It takes longer to adapt to the pain of unemployment than to losing a loved one.

title: Putin Says U.S. Is in Deep Internal Crisis
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia on Sunday described the United States as a country gripped by a deep internal crisis and attributed it to what he said was a refusal by opponents of President Trump to accept his obvious 2016 election victory and his legitimacy as leader.

title: Police Killings Prompt Reassessment of Laws Allowing Deadly Force
description: ATLANTA  The swift decision on Sunday to fire the white Atlanta police officer who shot and killed a black motorist intensified the growing re-examination of the use of deadly force by the police, challenging longstanding principles that have given law enforcement officers wide latitude in cases in which an encounter ends with a death.

title: Newsrooms Are in Revolt. The Bosses Are in Their Country Houses.
description: EAST HAMPTON, N.Y. Real estate out here is too expensive for a working person, so the East Hampton Golf Club usually provides shared houses for its caddies. But Covid-19 means no boardinghouses, and no boarding means no caddies, and no caddies means that the media moguls who pay more than $400,000 to join (putting it in the middle range for initiation fees in the Hamptons) now must pull their own clubs around, which theyve been telling one another reminds them of their youth, and which is just the kind of sacrifice that the coronavirus has brought to East Hampton.

title: A Nerve-Racking Final Round Adds Drama to Golfs Fan-Free Return
description: The PGA Tour returned from a three-month layoff due to the coronavirus pandemic on Thursday. But to golf fans worldwide, the true measure, and appeal, of a tour event is a taut, nerve-racking final round.

title: Maria Ressa, Crusading Journalist, Is Convicted in Philippines Libel Case
description: MANILA  Maria Ressa has been accused of fraud, tax evasion and receiving money from the Central Intelligence Agency. She has been arrested twice and posted bail eight times.

title: The Pandemic Claims New Victims: Prestigious Medical Journals
description: One study promised that popular blood-pressure drugs were safe for people infected with the coronavirus. Another paper warned that anti-malaria drugs endorsed by President Trump actually were dangerous to these patients.

title: Billions Season 5, Episode 7 Recap: Moral Inconvenience
description: Bobby Axelrod can see the Matrix. Or whatever the moneymaking equivalent of the Matrix would be.

title: No Corrections: June 15, 2020
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, June 15, 2020.

title: Quotation of the Day: Amid Revolt, Bosses Sun in Hamptons
description: Being a leader means staying with your people and seeing what they see.

title: Break the China Habit? Lobsters, Lights and Toilets Show How Hard It Is
description: As the coronavirus pandemic amplifies longstanding concerns over the worlds economic dependence on China, many countries are trying to reduce their exposure to Beijings brand of business.

title: Reopenings in Europe, Far-Right Protests, Facebook: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Monday: Original Cast Album: Company and Songland
description: ORIGINAL CAST ALBUM: COMPANY (1970) Stream on the Criterion Channel. Stephen Sondheims formally adventurous 1970 Broadway musical about modern relationship issues is viewed by many as his breakout work as an independent creative force. D.A. Pennebaker, the filmmaker known for his documentary work on the upheaval and music of the 1960s and 70s, was on hand when the original cast gathered at The Church, a Columbia Records studio in Midtown Manhattan, to record the shows cast album. Sondheim is featured in the documentary, as is Elaine Stritch, who played Joanne, and other performers. Among the songs captured are Another Hundred People and The Ladies Who Lunch.

title: The Quiet Bazaar: Soccers Transfer Market Braces for the Unknown
description: If you are enjoying this newsletter every week, please pass it on to a friend (or four) and tell them to sign up at nytimes.com/rory.

title: A War Against Climate Science, Waged by Washingtons Rank and File
description: WASHINGTON  Efforts to undermine climate change science in the federal government, once orchestrated largely by President Trumps political appointees, are now increasingly driven by midlevel managers trying to protect their jobs and budgets and wary of the scrutiny of senior officials, according to interviews and newly revealed reports and surveys.

title: Inside the Sophisticated Campaign to Save Mens Running at Brown
description: Fergal Mullen, a venture capitalist in Europe, spent the end of May resigned to a sobering prospect: The varsity mens cross-country and track and field teams at Brown, where he had been a team captain in 1988, would be shut down.

title: Police Chiefs Are Finding Job Security Is Hard to Come By
description: Erika Shields was not your old-line, law-and-order police chief.

title: For Migrants in Russia, Virus Means No Money to Live and No Way to Leave
description: MOSCOW  Migrant workers from Central Asia, shrugging off the risk of coronavirus infection, have gathered in groups each day outside their countries embassies in Moscow, banging on doors and fences and shouting for officials to come out and tell them when they can finally get on a charter flight home.

title: Stocks Climb After Fed Details Bond-Buying Plan
description: This briefing is no longer being updated. Follow live developments here.

title: What We Learned From London Fashion Week
description: LONDON  This past weekend was always going to be unlike any London Fashion Week before.

title: Russian Court Sentences American, Paul Whelan, to 16 Years on Spy Charges
description: MOSCOW  A court in Moscow on Monday sentenced an American who claims he was framed by Russian agents to 16 years in a high-security prison for espionage, delivering another blow to President Trumps already faltering efforts to get along with Russia.

title: Pakistans Lockdown Ended a Month Ago. Now Hospital Signs Read Full.
description: KARACHI  Pakistanis stricken by the coronavirus are being turned away from hospitals that have simply closed their gates and put up signs reading full house. Doctors and nurses are falling ill at alarming rates, and are also coming under physical assault from desperate and angry families.

title: Were Feeding America, but Were Sacrificing Ourselves
description: Tyson Foods continues to run its processing lines at a breakneck speed, making it impossible for workers to social distance

title: Trying to Parent My Black Teenagers Through Protest and Pandemic
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: The Rising Trump Lawyer Battling to Reshape the Electorate
description: As victory laps go, it was remarkably low-key.

title: Troubling Tableau in 11th Circuits Prisoner Cases, Sotomayor Says
description: WASHINGTON  It is not easy for prisoners to challenge their convictions in federal courts anywhere in the nation. But it is especially tough in the United States Court of Appeals for the 11th Circuit, which hears appeals from Alabama, Florida and Georgia.

title: Were Feeding America, but Were Sacrificing Ourselves
description: Youre a worker at a Tyson Foods poultry plant and still punching in even though the coronavirus continues to run rampant through meat-processing plants across the country. Youre proud that your job helps keep supermarkets stocked. Your family supports Donald Trump. But the presidents executive order to keep meat plants open  issued after the Tyson Foods chairman, John Tyson, publicly warned of supply shortages  worries you. You think company leadership pushed for plants to stay open and to run at top speed instead of doing more to keep workers safe. This is the reality for Jerald Brooks, a Tyson poultry processing plant worker in Glen Allen, Va. He is not alone.

title: The Court-Martial of Donald J. Trump
description: The first time I saw President Trump referred to as Cadet Bone Spurs I laughed, the second time I smiled and the third time I cringed. Its an apt slur, but it lumps him together with all the other politicians whose military huzzahs contradict their personal histories and whose insult to our men and women in uniform can be reduced to dodging the draft.

title: Dont Cheer Too Soon. Keep an Eye on the Core Jobless Rate.
description: The recent jobs report for May seemed to bring good news: more jobs and lower unemployment. But the coronavirus pandemic has broken most economic charts and models, and all the numbers we regularly watch need a closer look. The decline in unemployment was actually driven by a drop in temporary layoffs. Strip those out, and what remains  lets call it the core unemployment rate  rose in May.

title: How to Think About Pregnancy Risks
description: Advice about pregnancy has become so prevalent that it has become almost an industry unto itself. Personal behavior can be important, but relative to a lot of the expectations heaped on pregnant women, it can also easily be overstated.

title: In a Crisis, We Can Learn From Trauma Therapy
description: This article is the first in a series on resilience in troubled times  what we can learn about it from history and personal experiences.

title: A Conspiracy Made in America May Have Been Spread by Russia
description: [Follow our Election Day live tracker.]

title: These Kids Are Done Waiting for Change
description: NASHVILLE  In real life, Nya Collins, Jade Fuller, Kennedy Green, Emma Rose Smith, Mikayla Smith and Zee Thomas had never met as a group when they came together on Twitter to organize a youth march against police violence. It was unseasonably hot, even for Middle Tennessee, with rain predicted, and earlier protests here had ended in violence, with the Metro Nashville Courthouse and City Hall in flames. Collectively, these are not the most promising conditions for gathering a big crowd, much less a calm one. But the teenagers were determined to press on, even if hardly anyone showed up.

title: Corporate America Says Black Lives Matter. It Needs to Hold Up a Mirror.
description: If the corporate bluster of the past week around diversity sounds familiar, its probably because youve been hearing it for years.

title: Expecting Students to Play It Safe if Colleges Reopen Is a Fantasy
description: A number of American colleges and universities have decided to bring students back to campus this fall, believing they can diminish the risk of coronavirus transmission if everyone wears masks, uses hand sanitizer and social distances. Some schools also plan to reconfigure dorms to create family-sized clusters of uninfected students, who could socialize in relative safety, if only with their suite mates.

title: A Deal to Save Medicaid, the Unemployed and State Budgets
description: Covid-19s economic devastation has revealed gaping holes in our safety net, as decades-old structures for Medicaid and unemployment insurance are compounding the pain caused by disease and job loss. Lets be honest, we would not today design them as they were created. The CARES Act took steps to fix these programs, but they need permanent institutional reform and modernization.

title: Looking at Masks and Respiratory Health
description: Starting with the first reports of breathing difficulties among people who contracted Covid-19 and extending now to those wearing masks to limit the risk of acquiring or unwittingly transmitting the virus, the ability to breathe normally has become a common concern.

title: Shopping for String Lights
description: Outdoor string lights have surged in popularity, thanks to their ability to make a simple backyard or patio feel like a romantic outdoor cafe. And that makes them especially appealing during a summer of social distancing.

title: They Live Alone in Ghost Towns
description: There are some 3,800 ghost towns in the United States, most abandoned in the 19th and early 20th centuries in favor of bigger cities, or casualties of changing industry. Some languish as ruins, others are designated as national parks. And a rare handful are in the midst of being developed into luxury vacation spots.

title: Charter Schools, Some With Billionaire Benefactors, Tap Coronavirus Relief
description: WASHINGTON  Charter schools, including some with healthy cash balances and billionaire backers like Michael Bloomberg and Bill Gates, have quietly accepted millions of dollars in emergency coronavirus relief from a fund created to help struggling small businesses stay afloat.

title: Oumuamua: Neither Comet nor Asteroid, but a Cosmic Iceberg
description: It has been two and a half years since astronomers in Hawaii discovered a strange, cigar-shaped object speeding through the solar system on a trajectory from far away and toward even farther away. Today Oumuamua, the Hawaiian term for scout, as the object was named, is now long gone, somewhere between the orbits of Saturn and Neptune and on its way to the Great Out There, but astronomers are still wondering and debating what it was.

title: When Pyer Moss Brought Police Brutality to the Runway
description: In the last two years, Kerby Jean-Raymond, the founder of Pyer Moss, has become something of a New York Fashion Week star, famous for taking the African-American experience and putting it front and center on the runway, using such inspiration figures as the black cowboy and Sister Rosetta Tharpe. He has won the CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund award, become artistic director of Reebok Studies__ and collaborated with Hennessy.

title: Portraits of Everyday Life in the Indian State of Gujarat
description: With travel restrictions in place worldwide, weve launched a new series, The World Through a Lens, in which photojournalists help transport you, virtually, to some of our planets most beautiful and intriguing places. This week, Michael Benanav shares a collection of portraits from Gujarat, a state in western India.

title: Jon Stewart Is Back to Weigh In
description: In the five years since Jon Stewart left The Daily Show, American politics has been in a state of constant turmoil and he has remained mostly out of the spotlight.

title: Pence Tells Governors to Repeat Misleading Claim on Outbreaks
description: This briefing has ended. Read live coronavirus updates here.

title: How New York Is Restricting Police Tactics
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Adviser to Manchester City Owner Has Role in Newcastle Sale
description: LONDON  A trusted adviser to the billionaire Gulf owner of the English Premier League champion Manchester City has emerged as a key player in discussions to sell another Premier League club, Newcastle United, to a group led by Saudi Arabias sovereign wealth fund.

title: What Weve Learned About the Coronavirus
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device:Via Apple Podcasts | Via Spotify | Via Stitcher

title: Coronavirus Breaches Chinese Capital, Rattling Officials
description: The authorities in Beijing placed a swath of the city under lockdown on Monday and tested tens of thousands of people as they rushed to contain a new coronavirus outbreak that marked an unnerving breach in Chinas capital.

title: How Trump Is Fueling Progressivism
description: If youre trying to understand why the Black Lives Matter movement has ascended to another level, its helpful to think about an idea developed by the political scientist Christopher Wlezien: the thermostat theory of politics.

title: U.S. Pilot Dies in Fighter Jet Crash Off British Coast
description: LONDON  A United States Air Force pilot was killed on Monday when a fighter jet crashed during a routine training flight off the northeast coast of England, the Air Force said.

title: Captain of the Day Traders
description: Want this in your inbox each morning? Sign up here.

title: Chinas Economy Faces Another Hurdle: Darkened Movie Theaters
description: SHANGHAI  To the long list of obstacles holding back the Chinese economy when the world needs it most, add one more: padlocked movie theaters.

title: A Killing in Atlanta Stirs Fresh Anger
description: Streets say defund, Dems hear restructure. Its Monday, and this is your politics tip sheet.

title: Intruders Try to Kidnap a Chinese Appliance Tycoon
description: The Chinese police said on Monday that they had foiled what appeared to be a brazen kidnapping attempt aimed at one of Chinas richest men, a home-appliance tycoon whose company has ambitions to move from rice cookers and air-conditioners into the next-generation world of industrial robotics.

title: Trumps Niece to Publish Book With Harrowing Revelations
description: A niece of President Trump will divulge a series of damaging stories about him in an upcoming book, the first time that the president could be forced to grapple with unflattering revelations by a member of his own family.

title: The Long, Complicated History of Urban Music
description: The ongoing protests against police brutality in the United States are beginning to bring wider change and reflection. Over the last two weeks, thats meant that the music business, long a site of racial inequity, has been the subject of a reckoning. One of the first old structures to fall has been the category urban music, a quirk of nomenclature that goes back more than four decades, and has become such an elastic term that its almost lost all meaning.

title: Anything But Candy Land!
description: I have a confession: I hate board games.

title: What You Get for $3.2 Million in California
description: A Carpenter Gothic home in Napa, a midcentury-modern house in Palm Springs and a cottage in Carmel-by-the-Sea.

title: $3.2 Million Homes in California
description: Built as the home of Johnson Horrell, a Napa County judge, and his wife, Sarah, this house was the first on its block. In 1890, it was moved to a new lot, now within walking distance of downtown Napa. In the late 1940s, the house was subdivided into apartments. The current owner, who bought it in 2015, turned it back into a single-family house and did an extensive renovation to restore its original splendor, using raw materials sourced from the house.

title: How Paradise Highs Class of 2020 Got Its Graduation
description: Good morning.

title: Matthew Williams, Collaborator of Kanye West and Lady Gaga, Is Givenchys New Designer
description: Change is coming for Givenchy. The French brand is going to emerge from coronavirus confinement with not just new social distancing rules, but a whole new look. Two months after Clare Waight Keller stepped down as creative director, the house announced that it had named a new designer, and he comes not from the school of couture, but rather the school of Kanye.

title: How to Donate Blood
description: As the coronavirus spread across the country, the nations blood supply faced a dire shortage. Blood drives were canceled when businesses closed, and many people feared going into donation centers.

title: With New Policies, Cities Seek a Seismic Shift in Policing
description: [Atlanta Police Officer charged with murder in killing of Rayshard Brooks.]

title: 25 Million Applications: The Scramble for N.Y.C. Affordable Housing
description: For more than five years, William Sencion did the same task over and over. He signed onto the New York Citys housing lottery site and applied for one of the citys highly coveted, below-market apartments. Each time, he got the same response: silence.

title: Was It a Lost Psych-Funk Classic? Its Khruangbin, Right Now
description: In 2013, the producer and D.J. Bonobo released his version of Late Night Tales, the long-running musician-curated album series. The compilations theme was serene songs meant to soundtrack the night, and he included A Calf Born in Winter from a band called Khruangbin, an upstart Houston trio that hadnt yet made a full album.

title: After 13 Years on the Run, a Sudanese Militia Leader Appears in Court
description: A Sudanese militia leader appeared before the International Criminal Court on Monday, after 13 years on the run, to face charges of war crimes and crimes against humanity committed during the bloody conflict in the Sudanese region of Darfur from 2003 to 2004.

title: Supreme Court Wont Hear Case on California Sanctuary Law
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday turned down an appeal from the Trump administration seeking to challenge a California sanctuary law.

title: Amazon Says Jeff Bezos Is Willing to Testify Before Congress
description: WASHINGTON  Jeff Bezos, Amazons chief executive, is willing to testify before a House antitrust investigation into the market power of major tech companies alongside other chief executives, a lawyer for Amazon wrote to lawmakers on Sunday.

title: Civil Rights Law Protects Gay and Transgender Workers, Supreme Court Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court ruled on Monday that a landmark civil rights law protects gay and transgender workers from workplace discrimination, handing the movement for L.G.B.T. equality a long-sought and unexpected victory.

title: What to Cook Right Now
description: Good morning. You know that sense of satisfaction you get, cooking good food? Not just in making a recipe you found and having it come out edible, but in making it well, making it delicious, making it nice? Imagine how youll feel when youre done with this coconut pecan cake (above) that the pastry chef Dolester Miles makes at Chez Fonfon and Bottega, and occasionally at Highlands Bar and Grill, Frank and Pardis Stitts restaurants in Birmingham, Ala.

title: The Supreme Court Aligned With Public Opinion in Most Major Cases This Term
description: The justices confronted an unusually potent mix of political and social issues in the middle of both a presidential election year and a public health crisis.

title: Syrias Economy Collapses Even as Civil War Winds to a Close
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  President Bashar al-Assad, who has mostly won Syrias civil war, now faces an acute economic crisis that has impoverished his people, brought about the collapse of the currency and fueled a rare public rift in the ruling elite.

title: Why Werent We Video Calling All Along?
description: A couple of weeks ago, my mother and father, my sister and brother-in-law, and my fianc and I had our first-ever group FaceTime.

title: China Reports Progress in Ultra-Secure Satellite Transmission
description: The world of artificial satellites, silent in the void of space, might seem pacific. In fact its a high-flying battlefield rife with jamming, snooping, blinding, spoofing, hacking and hostility among the planets growing array of spacecraft and space powers. Now, Chinese scientists report new progress in building what appears to be the first unbreakable information link between an orbiting craft and its terrestrial controllers, raising the odds that Beijing may one day possess a super-secure global communications network.

title: U.S.T.A. Plans to Move Forward With U.S. Open Amid Pandemic
description: Despite major challenges created by the coronavirus pandemic, the United States Tennis Association is set to announce this week that it will hold the 2020 United States Open with the support of the mens and womens tours.

title: Portraits of Families in Protest
description: J. Jioni Palmer, a father of two young boys, couldnt sleep.

title: The Next Generation of Voices at the Childrens March in Brooklyn
description: Protesters wearing masks and clutching signs. Police officers armed with shields and batons. Crowds taking a knee together. Those global images of protests against police violence have become all too familiar. But on June 9, a different kind of demonstration took place in Brooklyn: It was for children, and dedicated entirely to their voices.

title: At 99, Al Jaffee Says Goodbye to Mad Magazine
description: Mad magazine is celebrating its longest-tenured contributor, Al Jaffee, with an issue devoted to him on the occasion of his retirement.

title: Sweet, Tender and Studded With Strawberries
description: Theres something so homey about a warm dessert so tender you must serve it with a big spoon and a deep bowl. Depending on the occasion, there are a couple of recipes you could try.

title: With Brexit Trade Talks at an Impasse, Boris Johnson Finally Engages
description: BRUSSELS  Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain, in his first direct talks with Brussels about Brexit since his country left the European Union at the end of January, agreed with European leaders on Monday to push ahead with intensified talks in July and August to try to reach a trade deal by the end of the year.

title: Review: Frontline Traces the Footsteps of Covid-19
description: The Virus: What Went Wrong?, a 90-minute installment of PBSs Frontline premiering Tuesday, resurfaces the story of the pandemic that felt like an inescapable catastrophe just three weeks ago. Making no mention of protests or police, its like a courier with an urgent message who lost his place in line.

title: Ralph Caplan, Design Critic Big on Sit-Ins but Not Chairs, Dies at 95
description: Ralph Caplan was the E.B. White of design writing. He disliked windy sentences and pompous clichs and was always ready to poke fun at orthodoxies. He said he wasnt sure he saw the point of a chair, since human beings could sit on pretty much anything except a cactus.

title: Museums Embrace Art Therapy Techniques for Unsettled Times
description: When the instructor asked him to describe his life in two words, Walter Enriquez chose carefully: fear and violence. He had spent decades as a policeman in Peru during the bloodiest days of armed conflict between government forces and guerrilla fighters that killed nearly 70,000 people. But he said that nothing could have prepared him for the extreme isolation and loneliness that come with quarantine. Having lost a handful of his friends and neighbors to the coronavirus pandemic, the 75-year-old retiree has turned toward art therapy programs offered by the Queens Museum to improve his mental health.

title: One Restaurants Survival Guide
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: F.D.A. Revokes Emergency Approval of Malaria Drugs Promoted by Trump
description: The Food and Drug Administration said on Monday that it was revoking emergency authorization of two malaria drugs to treat Covid-19 in hospitalized patients, saying that they are unlikely to be effective and could carry potential risks.

title: Lil Baby Returns to Top Chart With My Turn
description: Two weeks ago, the music industry observed an ad hoc blackout in solidarity with the protests over racism and police violence. Record companies, streaming services and others paused operations and pledged to support equality efforts.

title: BP Prepares for a Future That Needs Less Oil
description: BP sent a signal to investors on Monday that the economic shock of the pandemic would reverberate for years, and that less gas and oil would probably be needed in the future.

title: Biden and D.N.C. Raised Nearly $81 Million in May, a New High
description: Joseph R. Biden Jr. and the Democratic National Committee had, by far, their biggest fund-raising month of the campaign in May, pulling in $80.8 million as large and small donors alike consolidated behind the presumptive Democratic nominee ahead of his fall contest with President Trump.

title: Trump and Transgender Rights
description: To the Editor:

title: The 2021 Oscars Will Be Delayed
description: LOS ANGELES  The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences said on Monday that it would push back the next Oscars ceremony to April 25 from Feb. 28, citing the coronavirus pandemic. The postponement, the fourth since the Academy Awards were introduced in 1929, could prompt the Golden Globes and other entertainment award shows to recalibrate.

title: In Europe, Travel Returns, but Not Confidence About What Comes Next
description: LONDON  Europes internal borders, closed three months ago in a frenzy of panicked uncertainty, are opening again. The uncertainty remains even if the sense of panic has eased.

title: Gorsuch, Conservative Favorite Appointed by Trump, Leads Way on Landmark Decision
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Neil M. Gorsuch is a profoundly conservative jurist and one of the two appointments President Trump has made to the Supreme Court that Republicans expected would fundamentally shape it to their liking for a generation.

title: V.O.A. Directors Resign After Bannon Ally Takes Charge of U.S. Media Agency
description: WASHINGTON  Two veteran journalists in charge of Voice of America, Amanda Bennett and Sandra Sugawara, resigned on Monday as a result of the recent congressional confirmation of a conservative activist and filmmaker to be the head of the agency that oversees the government broadcast organization.

title: Kansas City Police Investigate Vandalism of Memorial to Lynching Victim
description: The authorities are investigating the vandalism of a sign that memorialized a Missouri man, Levi Harrington, who was lynched in the 1880s, the police in Kansas City, Mo., said on Monday.

title: For Sale: The Hair of the Virgin Mary
description: For a little more than $2,000, you can buy a small silver-plated case containing some hair of the Virgin Mary, a relic venerated by Catholic believers. Add a few hundred dollars, and youll get a wax-sealed reliquary carrying pieces of clothing worn by St. Peter and St. Paul, together with a yellowed record, handwritten in Latin, that supposedly attests to the relics authenticity.

title: W.N.B.A. and Players Agree to Plan for 22-Game Season Starting in July
description: W.N.B.A. players have ratified a plan between the league and the players union to play a 22-game season, beginning in late July, along with a full playoff schedule, all at IMG Academy in Bradenton, Fla., the league announced Monday.

title: After A.L.S. Diagnosis, Rebecca Luker Is Proud I Can Still Sing
description: It takes a lot for Rebecca Luker to sing these days.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Some residential compounds in Beijing were under lockdown on Monday and tens of thousands were tested for the coronavirus as the government rushed to contain a new cluster of infections.

title: The Only West End Show Still Standing
description: NETHER WHITACRE, England  Last Tuesday, Morgan Philpott and Neal Foster of the Birmingham Stage Company were in the middle of rehearsing the latest Horrible Histories show: a highly successful family theater series in Britain where the countrys past is explained with the aid of fart jokes.

title: Fatal Shooting at a Wendys in Atlanta
description: To the Editor:

title: Baruch Haviv, Pilot, Landlord and Opera Fan, Dies at 82
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: The Impact of Disparities on Childrens Health
description: You might not have noticed it (theres a lot going on) but there was some good news last week in a study in JAMA that suggested that racial disparities in extremely premature infants were shrinking. The study looked at more than 20,000 extremely preterm infants (22 to 27 weeks gestation) born from 2002 to 2016. Mortality rates dropped over the course of the study, and though serious infections were more frequent in black and Hispanic infants early on, the rates converged with those of white infants as time went on.

title: A Half-Century On, an Unexpected Milestone for L.G.B.T.Q. Rights
description: When Donald J. Trump was elected president, gay and lesbian leaders warned that their far-reaching victories under Barack Obama  including the Supreme Courts decision legalizing same-sex marriage in 2015  were in peril, endangered by the imminent arrival of scores of conservative judges and full Republican control of the federal government.

title: The Statues Were Toppled. What Happens to Them Now?
description: Guido Gryseels has been getting calls for a week, asking if hed give some statues a new home. Hes the director of the Africa Museum in Tervuren, Belgium, and his institution, originally founded by Leopold II, might seem like a logical place to house monuments to the 19th-century king whose reign in Congo saw the murder and mutilation of at least 10 million Africans.

title: New Yorkers Flattened the Curve. Now Theyre Dropping Their Guard.
description: The critical indicators surrounding the coronavirus crisis in New York have clearly turned a corner: Deaths have slowed to a trickle, new cases have declined sharply and the numbers of hospitalizations and intubations have eased.

title: Air Service Was Deeply Cut, but Not to Places Like Lake Placid
description: As commercial air travel plummeted in recent months amid pandemic lockdowns and closings, the few people who did venture forth faced delays, cancellations and confusing social distancing messages.

title: Make a Compound Butter, and Use It on Your Next Meal
description: The term compound butter doesnt sound very delicious. If you werent already familiar with its creamy, herb-speckled joys, you might decide to give it a pass.

title: N.Y.P.D. Disbands Plainclothes Units Involved in Many Shootings
